p: Epidemiologic studies have identified several risk factors for severe disease, including previous exposure to heterologous DENV serotype, infection with certain viral strains and serotypes, young age, female sex, and certain gene variants of the host [8]– [12]. A high degree of serum viremia and NS1 antigenemia have been associated with a more severe disease outcome in endemic populations [13]– [17]. Differing results have also been reported [18], [19], though, and studies in travel-acquired dengue have been lacking.
